column4: can anyone tell me what will cause a windows machine to stop seeing my ubuntu server?
can the windows system ping the server by ip and/or name?
then it can see it
ah, that's different
look into samba and the smb.conf file if the sever is without desktop
how are you sharing the folders?
did you share via nautilus per chance?
just sharing doesn't exist
you can share folders using samba, ssh, ftp etc
the built in sharing options you set with the file manager (nautilus) are samba shares
it abstracts it for you
which is annoying as users arekept in the dark which makes support a little harder
if you run: smbtree ,on the server. Do you see its shares?
yes
if you run: sudo apt-get install samba ,does it say its already installed?
why did you install the server OS to then put a gui on it like a desktop OS?
if you wanted a desktop system then you should install a desktop system
then installing the desktop OS would have been smarter
should l not try installing samba via Ubuntu software center?
great place to find it. I have no idea how you were sharing before if its not installed
the gui you refer to uses samba dude
should do
